title: תפילת הודיה לחברה למניעת אכזריות לילדים | Prayer of Thanksgiving for the National Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Children (Office of the Chief Rabbi of the United Hebrew Congregations, 1954)
author: Office of the Chief Rabbi of the United Hebrew Congregations

coauthors.name: Office of the Chief Rabbi of the United Hebrew Congregations
coauthors.bio: The Office of the Chief Rabbi is the institutional identity for the Chief Rabbi of the United Hebrew Congregations of the Commonwealth [UK]. Unlike in other European countries, individuals serving as the Chief Rabbi of the United Hebrew Congregations are not formally designated by an authoritative state or civic body. Rather, the "office" is occupied by the senior rabbi of the United Synagogue, the umbrella institution for its affiliated Orthodox and Ashkenazi synagogues in the United Kingdom. The position of Chief Rabbi in the UK grew out of an 18th century desire among British Jewry for a respected representative figure comparable to the Archbishop of Canterbury for Anglican Christians. Rabbi Aaron Hart (1670–1756), rabbi of the Great Synagogue in London since 1704, was thus regarded by the 1750s as the first of the British chief rabbis. Over the next century and as British Jewry continued to grow, by the tenure of Rabbi Nathan Marcus Adler (from 1845-1890) the communal leadership and halakhic authority of the position had become firmly established. When in 1870, the Great Synagogue joined with four other synagogues, and was formally recognized as the United Synagogue by an Act of Parliament, the Chief Rabbi was legally established as its head. The current chief rabbi of the UHC and senior rabbi of the United Synagogue is Rabbi Sir Ephraim Mirvis. (The Office of the Chief Rabbi should not be mistaken for the London Beit Din, the Court of the Chief Rabbi of the United Hebrew Congregations.)

excerpt: Prayer of Thanksgiving on the Occasion of the 70th Anniversary of the National Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Children, to Be Recited on Sabbath 22nd May 1954 / 19th Iyyar 5714 after the Prayer of the Queen and the Royal Family (London: 1954, Office of the Chief Rabbi) . . .
content:
Source (Hebrew) Translation (English)
אָנָּא. אֵל שַׁדַּי רַחוּם אָב לַכֹּל
סוֹמֵךְ נוֹפְלִים וְסוֹעֵד נֶחֱשָׁלִים
אֵלֶיךָ נִשָׂא לְבָבֵינוּ
בִּתְפִלָה וּבְהוֹדָיָה
אֲשֶׁר בְּרַב טוּבְךָ וְחַסְדְּךָ עֵינֶךָ צוֹפִיהָ עַל בָּנִים
אוּמְלָלִים חַסֵרֵי יֶשַׁע וּמַחְסֶה הוֹרִים׃
אָנָּא אַב הָרַחֲמִים.
הַעֲבֵר רוּחַ עִוְעִים וְאַכְזָרִיוּת
מְלִבּוֹת בְּנֵי אָדָם
אֲשֶׁר לֹא יִמְעֲלוּ עוֹד מַעַל בְּנַעַר וְעוּל יָמִים׃
Almighty and all-merciful God, Who art the Father of all
and Who upholdest the weak and the helpless,
to Thee we lift up our hearts in thanksgiving
for Thy gracious and all-sustaining Providence
in watching over the well-being of those of Thy children
who are left without parental care and protection.
We pray Thee, Father of Mercy,
remove from the hearts of men
the spirit of cruelty and indifference
that causes them to neglect hapless young beings.
אָבִינוּ שֶׁבַּשָּׂמָיִם.
בָּאנוּ לְפָנֶיךָ בְּיוֹם שַׁבַּת קֹדֶשׁ זֶה בְּתּוֹדָה וּבִתְהִלָה
עַל אֲשֶׁר נָטַעְתָּ רוּחַ רַחֲמִים חֶמְלָה וַחֲנִינָה בְּלִבּוֹת אֲנָשִׁים וְנָשִׂים
הַמַּאֲצִילִים מֵאַהֲבָתָם וְחֶמְלָתָם
עַל נַעַר וְנַעֲרָה יֶלֶד וְיַלְדָה הַנְּתוּנִים בִּמְצוּקָה׃
הֱיֵה־נָה עִם אַנְשֵׁי הַחֶבְרָה לִמְנִיעַת אַכְזָרִיוּת לִילָדִים.
הַצְלַח אוֹתָם בְּמַעֲשֵׂה הַחֶסֶד דְּבַר יוֹם בְּיוֹמוֹ
כַּאֲשֶׁר הָיִיתָ עִם רִאשׁוֹנֵי־הַמְּיַסְּדִים׃
חָזֵּק־נָא אֶת מַאֲמַצֵּיהֶם
הַדְרֵךְ אוֹתָם בַּעֲצָתְךָ הַטּוֹבָה
כּוֹנֵן צְעָדֵיהֶם
וְהוֹלִיכֵם אֶל כָּל מָקוֹם בּוֹ תִהְיֶה פְעוּלָתָם לְהוֹעִיל וְלִבְרָכָה׃
הָרֵק בִּרְכָתְךָ עַל עֲבָדֶיךָ אֵלֶּה שׁוֹמְרֵי־אֱמֻנִים
הָעוֹסְקִים בַּעֲבוֹדַת הַחֶסֶד בֶּאֱמֶת וּבְתָמִים׃
O [Father in Heaven],
on this Sabbath we humbly offer our gratitude to Thee
for the men and women who, moved by compassion, kindness and sympathy,
bring pity and love and mercy
to all young people in distress.
Be with them in their daily acts of benevolence
as Thou hast been with their predecessors,
the founders of the National Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Children.
Strengthen them in their endeavours,
give them good counsel,
direct their footsteps,
guide them to every place where their labours are needed.
Cause Thy blessings to rest upon these selfless guardians who,
with heart, devotion and zeal, carry on the beneficent work.
 
שְׁמַר־נָא צֵאתָם וּבוֹאָם
מֵעַתָּה וְעַד עוֹלָם.
אָמֵן׃
O Lord,
preserve their going out and their coming in,[1] Cf. Ezekiel 46:10 
from this time forth and forevermore.
Amen.

סדר תודה ותפלה למלאת שבעים שנה לחברה למניעת אכזריות לילדים להאמר בבית הכנסת ביום ש״ק פ׳ בחקתי שנת תש״ד לפ״ק | “Prayer of Thanksgiving on the Occasion of the 70th Anniversary of the National Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Children, to Be Recited on Sabbath 22nd May 1954 / 19th Iyyar 5714 after the Prayer of the Queen and the Royal Family (London: 1954, Office of the Chief Rabbi)”.
